revised_title: Investigating DNA and Nuclear Protein Synthesis in Normal and Tumor Strain Cells
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on five types of cells grown in tissue culture to study the synthesis of deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) and nuclear protein in normal and tumor strain cells. They found that in normal cells, DNA and protein synthesis begin together, while in tumor cells, nuclear protein synthesis starts before DNA synthesis and appears to be a continuous process. This suggests that part of nuclear protein synthesis in tumor cells may be independent of normal genetic control.
